ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I gained several basic skills in inorganic chemistry lab work.
How to more independently operate in a laboratory setting. Coordination complex synthesis; using lab equipment such as IR spectroscopy, UV-Vis, NMR; catalytic reactions
Synthetic skills, knowledge about spectroscopic techniques in inorganic chemistry
I was able to hone my abilities in preparing lab reports much better.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Honestly, it was a pretty well executed course. The experiments were engaging and I really enjoyed the fact we had to write like actual scientists, which are skills I know I will need in the future.

I enjoyed the independence students got during experimental work, which allowed us to develop our laboratory skills and let students experience a little bit of what independent research may be like.

The only thing in terms of course improvement is if the specifications for writing assignments could be written out in an announcement/ file instead of just in said class. This way students can make sure they are meeting all of the requirements of an assignment.

Weaknesses -- unclear instructions for assignments & due dates (but if you ask he gives a lot of help)

Strengths -- everything else; cool experiments, Dr. Parr is super knowledgable and helpful. You get a ton of feedback on your writing -- this class genuinely improves your scientific writing.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes-this is a fantastic class to take as an advanced lab because the writing component gives you crucial skills that you'll need regardless of where you specialize in chemistry.

Yes! This should be the advanced lab that chemistry majors take. The lab assume students to be more mature in their lab experience and give them freedom to make choices in an experimental setting. Additionally, the course focuses on how to write a research paper with a focus on clarity and conciseness. I feel that my writing has definitely improved after the course.
Yeah, I highly recommend it as your advanced lab.
I would recommend it as it teaches prospective scientists the best way to write lab reports.
